head.supplied: VICTORIA. ¶ No. ¶ 1 ¶ 17th Novbr 1890 ¶ REQUISITION ¶ For the undermentioned ¶ Building ¶ for the Department of ¶ Govt. Botanist ¶ at ¶ Melbourne...

div.p: R91/1901, unit 584, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department. Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Requisition written by G. Luehmann and signed by M. See also T. Wilson to M, 3 March 1891.

div.p:
For the undermentioned Building for the Department of Govt. Botanist at Melbourne
The requisition form also has columns to be filled in at the Public Works Department, these have not been reproduced here.

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border-left: none; border-right: none; border-top: 0.75pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 0.75pt solid #000000;
cell.p: Description of Furniture and Fittings, Fencing, Repairs to Buildings, Rental of Premises, &c., with full particulars, dimensions, &c.

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border-left: 0.75pt solid #000000; border-right: none; border-top: 0.75pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 0.75pt solid #000000;
padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border-left: none; border-right: none; border-top: 0.75pt solid #000000; border-bottom: none;
cell.p: Brick Building (one room) for the reception of botanical collections and for preserving apparatus

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Signature of Officer requiring the Service Ferd. von Mueller

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Signature of the Head of Department

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

p.seg: To the Hon. the Commissioner of Public Works

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: MS annotation, 16 February 1891: 'One room in brick about 16.0 x 14.0 £180 to be erected separate from other buildings.'

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: On 23 February the Secretary of Public Works noted for M's information: 'Estimated & returned for signature & approval of Minister'. M forwarded the requisition on 25 February: 'For favorable consideration submitted to the honorable the Chief Secretary'.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: On 3 March 1891 a Treasury offical minuted: 'An account for the sum of £33-0-6 has been charged against this vote of £180 Treasury Voucher 7457 of 8/9/90'. The next day Wilson asked: 'What for?' An extra note marked 'Account of W. H. Williams', presumably of the Treasury, lists the account: 'Cementing exterior of Botanic Museum and new ceiling, as per contract 117.15.0 Extras 32.5.6 [total] 150.0.6 By previous payments 117 [remainder] £33.0.6 a/c of £33.0.6 paid 8/8/90.'
